title: Wanting to buy or trade for t204 commons (tradelist attached)
author: shammus

posts.post_title: Wanting to buy or trade for t204 commons (tradelist attached)
posts.post_content:
Needing most of the cards in this set still.  Willing to buy and I have a few cards below I can trade or put towards the cards as well.  Thanks in advance!

Brian
[url]redmaccie@hotmail.com[/url]

e90-1 Baker (rookie) FR...a few lighter wrinkles...light writing on back 
e90-3 Hahn FR..wrinkling...widely considered the toughest card in the e90-3 set 
e92 Davis (horizontal) GD...wrinkling 
e92 Dougherty VG....one corner wrinkle...nice looking card! 
e93 Bender EX - tiny touches to corners but Trimmed 
e98 Davis FR - tiny bit of tape on back...chip in lower right corner 
e98 Mullin FR - 2 mm tear at top...nick below right elbow 
e98 Wagner GD - thin wrinkle at top. Tiny scratch immediately below it. No heavy wear or creasing. Great photo and color, back is clean and damage free. 
e102 Wagner (fielding) SGC 10 - creases/corner wear. VERY RARE variation....exceedingly difficult!! 
e103 Devlin FR - A few light wrinkles  
e103 Tenney FR - some minor chipping but not bad...no creases. IMO, the toughest card in the set 
1912 Zeenut Baker (horizontal) PSA 2 - two tiny corner creases...awesome pose and VERY difficult! 
1920 Zeenut Sands (PR-FR) - creasing 
t206 Myers PR/FR - interesting vertical miscut - caption is cut so that half shows on the bottom and half on the top....several wrinkles 
t212-1 Obak Martinke - beyond poor...heavy trim on bottom 
t222 Lee Magee SGC 10 - second toughest card in set
v61 Neilsons Type 2 Woodall SGC 80 - gorgeous card!! 
1910 group of 5 Wunc Colorized Portraits incl Bender and Jennings 
H-UNC 1928 Star Player Candy Charles Root SGC A - EXMT on front....sharp corners, great centering...no wear or wrinkling.  Staining on reverse 
R-UNC 1936 Candy Card Pep Young VG/EX - No wear, wrinkling and corners/edges are mostly sharp.
